title: Any help with this font?
content:
Hi,

Can anybody identify this one? I couldn't find it with any of the automated online tools (which previously helped with other fonts)... they only found similar but not quite the same fonts.
author: sfg

comments.content: Wasn't able to spot a match, only (a ton of) similars. It feels also "freebie" to me. As always for this kind of font, I'd say it is deeply rooted in " [Bauhaus](http://web.archive.org/web/20130620200529/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/bauhaus/)" (. Many freebies (an endless list actually) share the same backbone ( [Vomzom](http://web.archive.org/web/20130620200529/http:/www.dafont.com/vomzom.font) is one of them). Having a look to [Techno \> Sci-fi](http://web.archive.org/web/20130620200529/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=303), [Techno \> Various](http://web.archive.org/web/20130620200529/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=304) and [Basic \> Sans serif](http://web.archive.org/web/20130620200529/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=501) sections at DaFont could be helpful to spot either an alternative or a match. Good luck!
